frase.N1:
Here he flings the shutter, revealing your form.
You've been caught.

frase.N2:
With many a flirt and flutter,
you glide past the man,

frase.N3:
stepping inside with a dignity
of the saintly days of yore.

frase.N4:
Not the least obeisance made you,
not a minute did you stop or stayed.

frase.N5:
But, with mien of lord or lady,
you perched above his chamber door—

frase.N6:
Perched upon a bust of Pallas
just above his chamber door—

frase.N7: Perched, and sat, and nothing more.

frase.N8:
As he regarded you,
momentarily his sad fancy turned into smiling,

frase.N9:
Perhaps given the sight of grave and stern decorum
of the countenance which you wore.

frase.N1:
Though thy crest be shorn and shaven,
thou, art sure no craven,

frase.N2:
Ghastly grim and ancient Raven
wandering from the Nightly shore—

frase.N1:
Tell me what thy
lordly name is on the Night’s Plutonian shore!
